meanings.definition: To cause a flying object to fall by shooting it with a weapon.
meanings.sent1: The hunter tried to shootdown the bird with his rifle.
meanings.sent2: The military jet was able to shootdown the enemy drone.
meanings.sent3: The cowboy attempted to shootdown the flying saucer with his lasso.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp words seemed to shootdown his confidence instantly.
meanings.sent5: The storm's strong winds threatened to shootdown the fragile kite.

meanings.definition: The act of shooting down a flying object.
meanings.sent1: The shootdown of the enemy plane was a strategic victory.
meanings.sent2: The military celebrated the successful shootdown of the missile.
meanings.sent3: The shootdown of the UFO was the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: The shootdown of the drone was captured on camera.
meanings.sent5: The shootdown of the bird was a sad event for the birdwatchers.
